feat(pi-de): Add unit tests for SpawnModal, initStorage, patchLit

Add comprehensive test coverage for three Pi-DE modules:
- SpawnModal.test.tsx: 11 tests covering modal rendering, directory navigation, spawn operations
- initStorage.test.ts: 10 tests for MemoryBackend storage operations and AppStorage initialization  
- patchLit.test.ts: 4 tests for Lit element patching logic

All 59 tests pass. New tests achieve:
- 100% line coverage on initStorage.ts
- >80% coverage on SpawnModal.tsx
- Full coverage of Lit patching logic

Created pi-agent-helpers.ts with startPiAgent/stopPiAgent/waitForNode/createTempCwd helpers using tmux sessions. Created lifecycle.test.ts with 4 tests: agent registers on startup, deregisters on /quit, two agents in same cwd both register, proxy returns init_state for live agent. All pass (22s total). Fixed macOS /var → /private/var symlink issue with realpathSync.
Message round-trip integration tests (Web → Agent → Web)

Created message-roundtrip.test.ts with 4 tests using real pi agents: receives init_state on proxy connect, send text → agent processes and streams response back (verifies message_start/message_update/message_end events), init_state contains history after a conversation turn, multiple proxy clients both receive events. All pass (12s total). Built connectProxy() helper with event-driven waitFor() pattern that avoids BufferedWs race conditions.

feat(integration-tests): Add Pi-DE browser rendering tests with surf

- Created browser-rendering.test.ts with 8 comprehensive tests
- Tests verify Pi-DE loads successfully with no console errors
- Tests check roster display, content rendering, and layout integrity
- Tests validate UI interaction, viewport sizing, and DOM structure
- Uses surf CLI with --tab-id isolation to avoid hijacking user tabs
- Starts hypivisor, pi agent, and Pi-DE dev server in beforeAll
- All tests pass (8/8, 18.3s total)

feat(integration-tests): Cross-channel message visibility and TUI interaction tests

Task: task-6

Added integration-tests/src/cross-channel.test.ts with 6 comprehensive tests:
- Web → TUI visibility: messages sent via proxy appear in TUI output
- TUI → Web visibility: messages typed in TUI appear as WebSocket events
- TUI response → Web events: assistant responses to TUI prompts flow to WebSocket clients
- Concurrent clients: web client sees TUI-initiated messages
- Follow-up from web during TUI streaming: both messages appear in conversation
- Concurrent web clients: both see messages from each other and TUI

All 6 tests pass (51.6s total). Tests use:
- Real pi agents in tmux sessions
- hypivisor registry with proxy relay
- BufferedWs for reliable event collection
- tmux capture-pane polling for TUI verification
- Unique markers to avoid false matches
